Class AbstractCommonPlotOptions

java.lang.Object
  com.vaadin.addon.charts.model.AbstractConfigurationObject

All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractPointPlotOptions, PlotOptionsPie
public abstract class AbstractCommonPlotOptions
extends AbstractPlotOptions

This abstract class has some options that are relevant to many, but not all, chart types.

See Also:

Method Detail

setPointPlacement

public void setPointPlacement(PointPlacement pointPlacement)
In a column chart, when pointPlacement is PointPlacement.ON, the point will not create any padding of the X-axis. In a polar column chart PointPlacement.ON means that the first column points directly north. If pointPlacement is PointPlacement.BETWEEN, the columns will be laid out between ticks. This is useful for example for visualizing an amount between two points in time or in a certain sector of a polar chart. Defaults to null in Cartesian charts, PointPlacement.BETWEEN in polar charts.

Parameters:
pointPlacement -

getPointPlacement

public PointPlacement getPointPlacement()
Returns:
the point placement or null if none.
See Also:

setAllowPointSelect(Boolean)

setAllowPointSelect

public void setAllowPointSelect(Boolean allowPointSelect)
Sets whether to allow points in this series to be selected by clicking on the markers, bars or pie slices. Defaults to false.

Parameters:
allowPointSelect -

setShadow

public void setShadow(Boolean shadows)
Sets whether to apply a drop shadow below the graph line. Defaults to true.
